result.title: contest
result.content:
F. Too big :

in this problem we find this series : {x , x+1 , x+1+3 , x+1+3+5 , x+1+3+5+7 , .... } {x , x+1 , x+4 , x+9 , x+16 , ..... } to find the sum of the first y element we can get out x from this series

x * y + [0+1+4+9+16+....+(y-1)*(y-1)]

to find the sum of {1 , 4 , 9 , 16 , ... , n*n}

we use this function : {1 , 4 , 9 , 16 , ... , n*n} = [ n * (n+1) *(2n+1) / 6 ]

http://aghandoura.com/PROBLEM/SEQUANCES/squarenumber/square.htm

in this problem we can't use inverse mod Because (10^8+6) is not prime

we know that [ n or (n+1) or (2n+1) ]divisible by 2 , and [n or (n+1) or (2n+1) ] divisible by 3

if n = 1 -> n = 1 , n+1 = 2 , 2n+1 = 3

if n = 2 -> n = 2 , n+1 = 3 , 2n+1 = 5

if n = 3 -> n = 3 , n+1 = 4 , 2n+1 = 7

. . . .

so we can Divide one of(n , (n+1) , (2n+1) ) on 2 and another on 3 .

E. Ahmad and Apple :

in this problem we should use sort with comparator .

G. Ahmad and Hotel :

in this problem we have n segment a[0] , a[1] , ... , a[n-1] and should find a[0] U a[1] U a[2] U ... U a[n-1]

https://ideone.com/HCR0da
